meanings.definition: A group of muscles that lift or elevate a body part.
meanings.sent1: The levatores in my back help me sit up straight.
meanings.sent2: The levatores in his arms are strong from lifting weights.
meanings.sent3: The levatores in the body are like little helpers, always ready to lift.
meanings.sent4: Her levatores worked tirelessly, lifting her spirits during tough times.
meanings.sent5: The levatores, like tiny cranes, hoisted the heavy load effortlessly.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that raises or lifts something up.
meanings.sent1: The crane operator was the levatores of the construction site.
meanings.sent2: The levatores of the team, she always lifted everyone's mood.
meanings.sent3: The levatores of the party, he lifted everyone's spirits with his jokes.
meanings.sent4: The levatores of the family, she always lifted them up when they were down.
meanings.sent5: The levatores of the group, he raised their hopes with his encouraging words.
